column4: how can i list all the files in a directory from the commandline, even hidden files?
ls -la
thankies :D
it's not an application, it's a website
it's not a website, it's a web-app. it runs under apache, yes, but it's also an application. the source has to be somewhere, and it's not in my www folder
it is a simple website, look in your apache config for the site-enabled and where the root for phpyadmin is
I did, it didn't say anything. i don't completely get the grep syntax, how might i search through my entire /etc/apache2 folder for "phpmyadmin" ?
go into the sites-enabled directoy and see what sites you have
it's only got 000-default in there, and it's not in that
where is the docroot for 00-default
/media/sdb2/www, and no phpmyadmin isn't in it
you may also want to check the config file for a redirect

i haven't found any. if i could just grep the entire /etc/apache2 folder for "phpmyadmin" i could probably find it, but i'm not sure the syntax for greping all the contents of all the files in a folder
grep -r
no
screen would be the only tool to allow that
what's screen?
dead cable
is there a link light on the nics
They are
do a tail -f /var/log/syslog - take the cable out, plug it back in see what you get
One sec
